SEARCH
Package com.project.RabbitRun.entity

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
com.project.RabbitRun.entity.Entity
com.project.RabbitRun.entity.Enemy
public class Enemy extends Entity
Represents an enemy entity in the Rabbit Run game. The enemy can move in four directions and detects collisions with tiles, players, and other enemies.
Version:
1.0

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(GamePanel gamePanel, int startX, int startY)
      Constructor to initialize the enemy with its starting position.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - The game panel in which the enemy exists.
      startX - The initial X-coordinate of the enemy.
      startY - The initial Y-coordinate of the enemy.

      Checks if a collision is currently detected.
      Overrides:
      isCollisionOn in class Entity
      Returns:
      True if a collision is detected, false otherwise.

      public void setStuckCounter(int stuckCounter)
      Sets the counter value for how long the enemy has been stuck.
      Parameters:
      stuckCounter - The stuck counter value to be set.

    • setCollisionOn

      public void setCollisionOn(boolean collisionOn)
      Sets whether a collision is currently detected.
      Overrides:
      setCollisionOn in class Entity
      Parameters:
      collisionOn - True if a collision is detected, false otherwise.

    • setDefaultValues

      public void setDefaultValues()
      Sets the default values for the enemy's speed and direction.

    • getEnemyImage

      public void getEnemyImage()
      Loads all enemy images required for different movement directions. The images are loaded from the "/Enemy" directory. If an image fails to load, an ImageLoadingException is thrown.

    • initializeEnemies

      public static List<Enemy> initializeEnemies(GamePanel gamePanel)
      Initializes a list of enemies at predetermined positions.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - The game panel in which the enemies exist.
      Returns:
      A list of enemies.

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Resets the enemy's position and attributes to their default values.

    • updateEnemy

      public void updateEnemy(Player player)
      Updates the enemy's movement and collision checks based on the player's position.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to track and interact with.

    • determineDirection

      public void determineDirection(Player player)
      Determines the direction of the enemy based on the player's position.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to track.

    • collisionWithEnemy

      public boolean collisionWithEnemy()
      Checks if this enemy is colliding with another enemy. Iterates through all enemies in the game panel and checks if this enemy's bounds intersect with the bounds of any other enemy. Ignores itself during the check.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with another enemy, false otherwise.

    • collisionWithPlayer

      public boolean collisionWithPlayer(Player player)
      Checks if this enemy is colliding with the player. Uses the bounding rectangles of both the enemy and the player to determine if there is an intersection, indicating a collision.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to check for collision with.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with the player, false otherwise.

    • currentDirection

      public void currentDirection()
      Moves the enemy in the current direction.

    • alternateDirection

      public void alternateDirection(int deltaX, int deltaY)
      Changes the direction if the enemy encounters an obstacle.
      Parameters:
      deltaX - Difference between the player's X position and enemy's X position.
      deltaY - Difference between the player's Y position and enemy's Y position.

    • changeDirection

      public void changeDirection()
      Reverses the current direction of the enemy.

    • applyOffset

      public void applyOffset()
      Applies a small random offset to the enemy's position when it is stuck.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws the enemy on the screen.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object used to draw the enemy.
